summary: Quality data on federal purchases can help provide transparency about spending and inform public policy. The Office of Management and Budget offers guidance for agencies to certify procurement data. But only about half of the agencies we reviewed confirmed doing so, and even fewer had met requirements in OMB's guidance. Similarly, the General Services Administration runs several systems that track procurement-related data from agencies. But...
title: Federal Spending Transparency: Actions Needed to Help Ensure Procurement Data Quality
